articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Pope Francis' funeral will be held on Saturday in St. Peter's Square, Roman Catholic cardinals decided on Tuesday, setting the stage for a solemn ceremony that will draw leaders from around the world.
articles.title: Pope Francis's funeral to be held on Saturday, many world leaders expected

articles.author: Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: At least five tourists were feared dead and eight people injured after suspected militants opened fire at them in India's Kashmir region on Tuesday, a police source told Reuters, in the worst such attack in the territory in nearly a year.
articles.title: Five tourists feared dead, eight injured in militant attack in Indian Kashmir, police source says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military launched one of the biggest waves of strikes in Gaza for weeks on Tuesday, residents said, and health officials issued a new warning that healthcare faced total collapse from Israel's blockade of all supplies.
articles.title: Israel steps up Gaza strikes; polio vaccination halted by blockade

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Tuesday said he was prepared to negotiate with Russia "in any format" once a ceasefire takes hold while the Financial Times reported that Russian President Vladimir Putin has offered to halt Moscow's invasion at the current frontlines.
articles.title: Ukraine presses for ceasefire as Russia reported to offer concession

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Tuesday urged Britain and the European Union to safeguard multilateral trading systems, as Beijing seeks to rally support from trading partners to counter U.S. tariff measures.
articles.title: China urges UK and EU to uphold multilateral trade in face of U.S. tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States is looking to sell more energy and defence equipment to India, Vice President JD Vance said on Tuesday on a visit to the country, adding that ties between the two countries will shape the century.
articles.title: Vance seeks closer US-India ties, warns of 'dark time' otherwise

articles.author: Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney took his election campaign to Quebec on Tuesday, saying only he could protect the predominantly French-speaking province from U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Carney appeals for support in Quebec, promises protection from Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia struck the Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia with two guided aerial bombs on Tuesday, killing a woman and injuring 15 other people including two children, regional governor Ivan Fedorov said.
articles.title: Russian attack kills woman in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia, governor says

articles.author: Loucoumane Coulibaly, Emmanuel Bruce, Benoit Nyemba
articles.description: Africans are hoping one of their own could become the first Black pope in modern history and build on Francis's legacy of championing the developing world, though the chances of that happening appear slim.
articles.title: Africans root for first Black pope in modern history

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli government shared and then deleted a social media post offering condolences over the death of Pope Francis, without saying why, though an Israeli newspaper linked the decision to the late pontiff's criticism of the war in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel shares, then deletes, condolences over pope's death
